cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 275 mi SSW of Nantucket, Massachusetts
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northeastward away from the U.S. East Coast toward Nova Scotia and the Gulf of St. Lawrence
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Nova Scotia (near Halifax to the south-west coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: N/A — all watches now confined to New England and Atlantic Canada
weather_observation.warning_coast: N/A — warnings only posted from SE Massachusetts northward
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Mid-Atlantic to Atlantic Canada, especially eastern Nova Scotia and Gulf of St. Lawrence; Georgia coast no longer affected
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: OCEANA NAS VA (closest listed point in probability table)
weather_observation.wind: Only residual breezy northerly winds (20–25 kt) possible; main gale area has shifted far to the north-east
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; surge warnings for Georgia coast were discontinued
weather_observation.rainfall: Showers possible but widespread heavy rain has ended
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and rip currents may persist for another 24 h, posing a hazard to port‐side small craft operations
